alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 3:43PM EDT until June 14 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Quitman County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Terrell County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 343 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southeast of Georgetown, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cuthbert, Georgetown, Shellman, Wire Bridge, Watson Crossroads, Crossroads, Ricks Place, Randolph Co A/p, Hatcher, Morris, Martins Crossroads, Benevolence, Springvale, Cotton Hill, Wades, Days Crossroads, Springvale Station, Pachitla, Peterson Hill and Coles. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southwestern Georgia.
